Token.Abstract: Protocol for encapsulating the context and state of a decoding process. A context object must always be able to clean itself up on dealloc and should not rely on finalize to clean it up.

return YES once if the decoding is known to have completed and any future call to decodeBytes will be a considered no-op (returning YES). If the decoder is provided a zero length buffer to decode, there is no more data to decode, but the decoder may continue decoding. The decoder will have it's decode method called until an error is encountered or hasFinished returns YES.
